title: Clean up: Simplify optional call chains
body:
- Simplify `if(Optional.isPresent())` that can be rewritten in the functional style.
- Simplify optional call chains to use `isPresent()` or `isEmpty()` correctly.

A more accurate description of changes can be seen at: https://github.com/apache/syncope/pull/284/files?w=1

title: Disable CXF Services Listing
body:
As Syncope 2.1.x is stuck on CXF 3.2.x, it is vulnerable to:

http://cxf.apache.org/security-advisories.data/CVE-2020-13954.txt.asc

I confirmed with this PR you can no longer see the services page (http://localhost:9080/syncope/rest/services)

Auto-configure session tracking modes
body:
When running with initializr in separate servlet container, session tracking modes are left to their defaults and `SessionConfiguringInitializer` backs away, as it only affects embedded servlet containers. This makes both COOKIE and URL modes available to the underlying response, which cause very strange behavior with URL encoding and inclusion of `jsessionid` in the URL, which in turn causes Spring Security to block the request as it sees `;` as a malicious character.

In this patch, the behavior for `SessionConfiguringInitializer` is partially emulated to set the session tracking modes based on configured application properties.

SYNCOPE-1589: WA WebAuthN Device Registration APIs
body:
Allows WA to manage WebAuthN device registration requests. 

In this pull request, authentication profiles are adjusted to include a reference to a `WebAuthnRegisteredAccount` that itself contains a list of `WebAuthnDeviceCredential` entries, allowing the account management facility to track multiple devices for the same profile owner. The `WebAuthnDeviceCredential` component tracks a few key pieces related to the device, and also tracks the entire record as a JSON blob where this record is deserialized back into an object representation that can be used by WA.

title: SYNCOPE-1580: Manage WA Configuration Properties/Schema
body:
See: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SYNCOPE-1580

- Provides a `WAConfigService`, along with relevant logic, dao and binder components to CRUD configuration entries. The caller of `WAConfigService` is required to push changes to WA once entries are stored, allowing WA to refresh itself, as it does today with authentication modules and the bootstrap process. `WAConfigService` provides for a flexible and generic way to manage *all* properties relevant to a Spring Boot application, whether they belong to CAS or some other specific Spring Boot setting.

- Presents a `WAConfigTO`, backed by the `WAConfigEntry` at the JPA layer to assist with `WAConfigService` implementation. The value of a configuration entry is supported by generics to allow creation/fetching of generic types for values (lists, numbers, etc)

- WA can only fetch/read/list configuration entries (i.e. anonymous is allowed). All other non-readonly operations are adjusted with the right permissions.

- Bootstrapping WA properties is now handled via special filters in type-safe maintainable ways (i.e no Strings to match property keys/names)that attempt to only fetch and collect properties supported by WA (and not everything supported by CAS properties). This means the collection of properties are either retrieved from authentication module configurations (LDAP, Syncope, etc) or from `WAConfigService` for things that may not be related to an authentication module (i.e. OIDC issuer field).

title: SYNCOPE-1545: Enable Swagger support for WA
body:
This pull request adjusts WA to turn on Swagger support via the `cas-server-support-swagger` dependency. In doing so,

1. The [CAS module is upgraded](https://apereo.github.io/cas/development/integration/Swagger-Integration.html) to base its swagger support on top of Swagger v2.1.x
2. The WA configuration does a simple bean override to present Syncope information to the Docklet, such as version, title, etc.
3. Default configuration is adjusted to consider actuators, controllers etc as part of Swagger UI.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1205228/87526392-02aa3e80-c6a0-11ea-979a-47f71b4b73c7.png)

1. Fixes issues with OIDC JWKS generation, set to include private key and algorithm

With these changes, and most recent CAS snapshot (WIP), OIDC functionality is restored back to normal.

title: Upgrade WA to 6.3.0
body:
This pull request upgrades the CAS component used by WA to 6.3.0 in prep for the next line of changes. Notable changes are:

1. Changes proposed and worked out by @DimaAy to improve service management facilities: https://github.com/apereo/cas/pull/4854
2. Improvements to Syncope Authn put together by @ilgrosso to remove leaking dependencies: https://github.com/apereo/cas/pull/4893
3. A redesign of account/device management for Google Authenticator MFA allowing multiple device registrations per user, and confirming accounts with an OTP before finalizing registration:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1205228/86257045-43995200-bbce-11ea-8689-388e022ebe1a.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1205228/86257064-4a27c980-bbce-11ea-8697-a0edc786da67.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1205228/86257072-4d22ba00-bbce-11ea-95cf-7f106aaf9df0.png)

Some things still need to be worked out. Switching to WIP for now.

title: SYNCOPE-1556: Manage OIDC JWKS
body:
- Allows Syncope to manage the JWKS store via REST endpoints
- Uses the `nimbus-jose-jwt` library to generate keys with algorithm RSA and length 2048
- Provides two sets of APIs; one to be invoked by the admin console for delete/update tasks and the other may be used by WA. (Permissions are kept separate)
- Adds tests and integration tests.

SYNCOPE-1566: Manage GAuth Credentials/Accounts
body:
- Provides endpoints, services and other components to manage WA GAuth accounts. Note that each account tied to an auth-profile in a one-to-one relationship. Supporting multiple devices per auth-profile can be an item to plan for in the future.

- Adds unit and integration tests

- Reorganizes the `wa-starter` module a bit to make sure components are moved to appropriate packages for audits and main config. 

- Renames a number of WA components to make sure they are prefixed with `SyncopeWA*` to be consistent with others.
